dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S716 : To modify the requirements under the STOCK Act regarding online access to certain financial disclosure statements and related forms.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid introduced the following bill; which was read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed

form.official-title: To modify the requirements under the STOCK Act regarding online access to certain financial disclosure statements and related forms.

section.header: Modifications of online access to certain financial disclosure statements and related forms

subsection.header: Public, online disclosure of financial disclosure forms

paragraph.text: Except with respect to financial disclosure forms filed by officers and employees referred to in paragraph (2), section 8(a) and section 11(a) of the STOCK Act (5 U.S.C. App. 105 note) shall not be effective.
The officer and employees referred to in paragraph (1) are the following:

subparagraph.text: Any officer occupying a position listed in section 5312 or section 5313 of title 5, United States Code, having been nominated by the President and confirmed by the Senate to that position.

paragraph.text: Section 1 of the Act entitled An Act to change the effective date for the internet publication of certain information to prevent harm to the national security or endangering the military officers and civilian employees to whom the publication requirement applies, and for other purposes is repealed.

paragraph.header: For members of congress and candidates
paragraph.text: Section 8(b) of the STOCK Act (5 U.S.C. App. 105 note) is amended—

clause.text: by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:
financial disclosure reports filed by Members of Congress and candidates for Congress,
reports filed by Members of Congress and candidates for Congress of a transaction disclosure required by section 103(l) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978, and
notices of extensions, amendments, and blind trusts, with respect to financial disclosure reports described in clauses (i) and (ii),

subparagraph.continuation-text: pursuant to title I of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App. 101 et seq.), through databases that are maintained on the official websites of the House of Representatives and the Senate.

clause.text: by striking the first two sentences; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by inserting be able to after shall; and
in paragraph (5), by striking under this subsection and inserting under paragraph (1)(B).

paragraph.text: Section 11(b) of the STOCK Act (5 U.S.C. App. 105 note) is amended—

clause.text: by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:

financial disclosure reports filed by the President, the Vice President, and any officer occupying a position listed in section 5312 or section 5313 of title 5, United States Code, having been nominated by the President and confirmed by the Senate to that position,
reports filed by any individual described in clause (i) of a transaction disclosure required by section 103(l) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978, and
notices of extensions, amendments, and blind trusts, with respect to financial disclosure reports described in clauses (i) and (ii),

subparagraph.continuation-text: pursuant to title I of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App. 101 et seq.), through databases that are maintained on the official website of the Office of Government Ethics.

clause.text: by striking the first two sentences; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by inserting be able to after shall; and
in paragraph (5), by striking under this subsection and inserting under paragraph (1)(B).
